text: Hi, is it possible to style the checkbox of the classic form in a custom template? There is some kind of snippet of css to use?
Yeah. I do it all of the time.
Make sure that form is not being output as an iframe

I used the `root` filter in a macro that automatically determines text color based off of a background color. Feel free to snag it. Thanks <@U6GNQ7JBU> and HS team for creating those filters. <https://gist.github.com/jfudman/7c162c010577f8c413bb17e3588fdc38>
if you post your code we might be able to help

I thought someone at HS once said that now included css files inside of other css files, can be updated without re-saving the parent css file? found a situation where that didn’t work. had to save parent.

didn’t even work when I used the debug param
huh. mind shooting me the example you're working with <@U7SL518D6>?
I know that HubSpot was based on Bootstrap 2. Is there a built in modal with HubSpot, or am I better of using a different library for a modal?
HubSpot’s bootstrap 2 is only the grid.  anything else you want you implement however you want
gotcha. I found an older article in the designers sub domain but it is not triggering for me so I thought I would ask
